questions.question: A store sells apples for $2/kg and oranges for $3/kg. The store opened in 2010 and has 15 employees working 8-hour shifts. If Tom buys 4 kg of apples, how much does he pay?
questions.hint: Multiply the weight of apples by the price per kg. Store info, employees, and shifts don't affect the calculation.

questions.question: A rectangular garden is 12 m by 8 m. The soil is clay-based and the fence is wooden. The owner is 45 years old. What's the garden's area?
questions.hint: Area of rectangle = length x width. Soil, fence type, and owner's age are irrelevant.

questions.question: Train A leaves at 9 AM traveling at 80 km/h. The train has 12 carriages, is painted blue, and can carry 500 passengers. How far does it travel in 3 hours?
questions.hint: Distance = speed x time. Carriages, color, and capacity are distractions.

questions.question: Emma earns $15/hour. She works at a cafe that opened in 2015 on Main Street. The cafe serves 200 customers daily. If she works 6 hours, what does she earn?
questions.hint: Multiply hourly rate by hours worked. Cafe details and customers don't affect earnings.

questions.question: A class has 28 students. 12 play soccer, 10 play basketball, and 6 play both. The classroom is air-conditioned and has 30 desks. How many play at least one sport?
questions.hint: Use the inclusion-exclusion principle: add both sports, then subtract those counted twice. Classroom features are irrelevant.

questions.question: A pizza restaurant makes 50 pizzas/day. Each pizza has 8 slices, costs $12, and takes 15 minutes to bake. The oven is Italian-made. If 3 pizzas are ordered, how many slices is that?
questions.hint: Multiply pizzas ordered by slices per pizza. Daily production, cost, and oven details are irrelevant.

questions.question: A triangle has sides 5 cm, 12 cm, and 13 cm. It's drawn on graph paper using a blue pen bought last Tuesday. What is its perimeter?
questions.hint: Perimeter = sum of all sides. Paper type, pen color, and purchase day don't matter.

questions.question: A library has 5,000 books. It's open 9 AM to 6 PM, has 3 floors, and was built in 1990. If 15% are fiction, how many fiction books?
questions.hint: Find 15% of the total books. Hours, floors, and year built are irrelevant.

questions.question: Sam cycles at 20 km/h on his red mountain bike bought for $300 last summer from Sports World. How long to travel 50 km?
questions.hint: Time = distance / speed. Bike color, type, price, and store are irrelevant.

questions.question: A bakery sells muffins in boxes of 6. Each muffin weighs 80g and is chocolate-flavored. The bakery has been open for 10 years. How many muffins in 9 boxes?
questions.hint: Multiply muffins per box by number of boxes. Weight, flavor, and years open don't matter.

questions.question: Water costs $2.50 per cubic meter. The pipe diameter is 5 cm and made of copper. The water company was founded in 1985. If a family uses 12 m3, what's the cost?
questions.hint: Multiply usage by price per unit. Pipe specs and company history are irrelevant.

questions.question: A movie theater has 15 rows with 20 seats each. The screen is 10 m wide, and popcorn costs $8. If 80% of seats are filled, how many people are watching?
questions.hint: First find total seats, then calculate 80% of that. Screen size and popcorn cost are irrelevant.

questions.question: A factory produces 200 toys/hour. It operates 8 hours/day, has 50 workers, and uses electric power costing $500/month. How many toys in 5 hours?
questions.hint: Multiply production rate by hours. Daily hours, workers, and power cost are irrelevant.

questions.question: John's age is twice Mary's. Mary's favorite color is blue and she has 2 cats. If Mary is 14, how old will John be in 5 years?
questions.hint: First find John's current age from Mary's, then add 5 years. Color and cats are irrelevant.

questions.question: A recipe needs 3 cups flour, 2 cups sugar, and 1 cup butter. The recipe is Italian, from a 1950s cookbook. To make 4 batches, how many cups of flour?
questions.hint: Multiply flour per batch by number of batches. Origin and cookbook year are irrelevant.

questions.question: A phone plan costs $45/month plus $0.10/minute for calls. The phone is silver and has a 6-inch screen. If Lisa uses 100 extra minutes, what's her bill?
questions.hint: Add the base cost to the cost of extra minutes. Phone color and screen size are irrelevant.

questions.question: A pool is 25 m long, 10 m wide, and 2 m deep. The tiles are blue and the water is chlorinated. The pool was built in 2018. What's the volume?
questions.hint: Volume of rectangular prism = length x width x depth. Tile color, water treatment, and year are irrelevant.

questions.question: A store offers 25% discount on all items. A dress originally costs $80 and is made of cotton from India. It comes in 5 sizes. What's the sale price?
questions.hint: Subtract 25% from the original price (or multiply by 0.75). Material, origin, and sizes are irrelevant.

questions.question: A car uses 8 liters of fuel per 100 km. The car is German, seats 5 people, and has a 50-liter tank. How much fuel for a 250 km trip?
questions.hint: Set up a proportion: if 8 liters per 100 km, how many for 250 km? Origin, seats, and tank size are irrelevant.

questions.question: Tim saves $12/week. He uses a blue piggy bank kept in his room on the top shelf. He's been saving since January. After 8 weeks, how much has he saved?
questions.hint: Multiply weekly savings by number of weeks. Piggy bank details and start date are irrelevant.

questions.question: A farm has 120 chickens and 45 cows. The barn is red and was painted last spring. Each chicken lays 1 egg/day. How many eggs in a week?
questions.hint: Multiply chickens by eggs per day, then by days in a week. Cows, barn color, and painting date are irrelevant.

questions.question: A conference room has tables arranged in 4 rows with 6 tables each. Each table seats 4 people. The room has AC set to 22C. Maximum capacity?
questions.hint: Multiply rows x tables x seats per table. AC temperature is irrelevant.

questions.question: A school has 600 students. 40% walk to school, 35% take the bus. The school was founded in 1965 and has 40 teachers. How many walk?
questions.hint: Find 40% of the total students. Year founded and teachers are irrelevant.

questions.question: A painter mixes 3 parts blue with 2 parts white. The paint brand is Premium and costs $25/liter. To make 15 liters of mixture, how much blue paint?
questions.hint: Blue is 3 out of 5 total parts. Find that fraction of 15 liters. Brand and cost are irrelevant.

questions.question: An elevator can carry 8 people or 600 kg. It travels at 2 m/s and was installed in 2020. If 35 people need to go up, how many trips minimum?
questions.hint: Divide total people by capacity per trip, then round up. Speed, weight limit, and year are irrelevant.

questions.question: A circular pond has radius 7 m. It contains goldfish and koi, and has a wooden deck around it. The pond is 2 m deep. What's its circumference? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Circumference $= 2\pi r$. Fish, deck, and depth are irrelevant.

questions.question: A test has 50 questions worth 2 points each. The test is on history, was written by Dr. Smith, and takes 90 minutes. If Amy gets 42 correct, what's her score?
questions.hint: Multiply correct answers by points per question. Subject, author, and time limit are irrelevant.

questions.question: A plane flies at 800 km/h. It has 180 seats, 6 crew members, and serves meals during the flight. The flight is 4 hours. What distance is covered?
questions.hint: Distance = speed x time. Seats, crew, and meals are irrelevant.

questions.question: A cylindrical tank has radius 3 m and height 5 m. It's made of steel and holds water for firefighting. What's its volume? ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Volume of cylinder $= \pi r^2 h$. Material and purpose are irrelevant.

questions.question: A shop sells shirts for $25 and pants for $40. The shop has 3 fitting rooms, opens at 10 AM, and accepts credit cards. If you buy 2 shirts and 1 pants, total cost?
questions.hint: Add the cost of 2 shirts plus 1 pants. Fitting rooms, hours, and payment methods are irrelevant.

questions.question: A book has 300 pages. It's a mystery novel by a British author, published in hardcover. If you read 25 pages per day, how many days to finish?
questions.hint: Divide total pages by pages per day. Genre, author nationality, and format are irrelevant.

questions.question: A company has 80 employees. 35% are managers. The office is downtown, has parking for 50 cars, and was renovated last year. How many are managers?
questions.hint: Find 35% of total employees. Location, parking, and renovation are irrelevant.

questions.question: A cake needs 45 minutes to bake. The recipe is from France and uses organic ingredients. If you start at 2:15 PM, when will it be done?
questions.hint: Add 45 minutes to the start time. Recipe origin and ingredients are irrelevant.

questions.question: A parking lot has 12 rows with 15 spaces each. It charges $3/hour and has security cameras. The lot is paved with asphalt. Total parking spaces?
questions.hint: Multiply rows by spaces per row. Price, cameras, and paving are irrelevant.

questions.question: A plant grows 3 cm per week. It's a tomato plant bought from a local nursery for $5. The pot is ceramic. How tall after 6 weeks if it started at 10 cm?
questions.hint: Add growth over 6 weeks to the starting height. Plant type, source, price, and pot material are irrelevant.

questions.question: A gym membership costs $30/month plus $50 sign-up fee. The gym has a pool, sauna, and 100 machines. It opened in 2019. Total cost for 6 months?
questions.hint: Add sign-up fee to (monthly cost x months). Amenities and opening year are irrelevant.

questions.question: A truck delivers 500 kg of goods. The truck is white, runs on diesel, and has 6 wheels. If 20% is furniture, how much furniture?
questions.hint: Find 20% of total weight. Truck color, fuel type, and wheels are irrelevant.

questions.question: A survey of 250 people showed 60% prefer tea. The survey was conducted online in March by a research firm. How many prefer tea?
questions.hint: Find 60% of the total surveyed. Survey method, month, and conductor are irrelevant.

questions.question: A rope costs $2.50 per meter. The rope is nylon, comes in 3 colors, and has a breaking strength of 500 kg. If you need 8 meters, total cost?
questions.hint: Multiply length needed by price per meter. Material, colors, and strength are irrelevant.

questions.question: A bus travels 240 km in 4 hours. It stops 3 times, carries 45 passengers, and the driver has 10 years experience. What's the average speed?
questions.hint: Average speed = total distance / total time. Stops, passengers, and driver experience are irrelevant.

questions.question: A rectangular photo is 15 cm wide and 10 cm tall. The frame is made of oak and costs $35. The photo was taken in Paris last summer. What's the perimeter?
questions.hint: Perimeter = 2 x (length + width). Frame material, cost, and photo location are irrelevant.

questions.question: A concert hall has 45 rows with 32 seats per row. Tickets cost $75 each and the show starts at 8 PM. The venue opened in 1985. What's the total capacity?
questions.hint: Multiply rows by seats per row. Ticket price, show time, and opening year are irrelevant.

questions.question: A water tank fills at 15 liters per minute. The tank is green, sits on a concrete base, and was installed by ABC Plumbing. How much water after 20 minutes?
questions.hint: Multiply fill rate by time. Tank color, base, and installer are irrelevant.

questions.question: A runner completes a 10 km race in 50 minutes. She wore Nike shoes, drank 3 water bottles, and her race number was 247. What was her average speed in km/h?
questions.hint: Convert minutes to hours, then divide distance by time. Shoes, water, and race number are irrelevant.

questions.question: A warehouse stores 2,400 boxes. Each box weighs 5 kg and is labeled with a barcode. The warehouse has 12 loading docks. If 1/4 of boxes are shipped, how many remain?
questions.hint: Subtract 1/4 from the total (or find 3/4 of total). Weight, barcodes, and docks are irrelevant.

questions.question: A taxi charges $3.50 base fare plus $2.25 per km. The taxi is yellow, has leather seats, and the driver's name is Mike. For a 6 km ride, what's the total?
questions.hint: Add base fare to (rate x distance). Taxi color, seats, and driver name are irrelevant.

questions.question: A school cafeteria serves 350 students daily. Each meal costs $4.50 and contains 600 calories. The cafeteria has 8 staff members. Daily revenue?
questions.hint: Multiply students by meal cost. Calories and staff are irrelevant.

questions.question: A cube has edges of 6 cm. It's made of plastic and painted red. The manufacturer is based in China. What's the surface area?
questions.hint: Surface area of cube = 6 x (edge squared). Material, color, and manufacturer are irrelevant.

questions.question: A fruit stand sells bananas at $1.20/kg. The stand is open 7 days a week and has a striped awning. The owner is Maria. If you buy 3.5 kg, total cost?
questions.hint: Multiply weight by price per kg. Days open, awning, and owner are irrelevant.

questions.question: A laptop battery lasts 8 hours. The laptop weighs 1.5 kg, has a 15-inch screen, and runs Windows. If used for 2.5 hours, what percentage of battery remains?
questions.hint: Find what fraction was used, then subtract from 100%. Weight, screen size, and OS are irrelevant.

questions.question: A hotel has 8 floors with 25 rooms per floor. Room rates start at $120/night. The hotel has a 5-star rating. Total number of rooms?
questions.hint: Multiply floors by rooms per floor. Rates and rating are irrelevant.

questions.question: A printer prints 12 pages per minute. The printer is wireless, weighs 8 kg, and uses HP ink cartridges. How many pages in 15 minutes?
questions.hint: Multiply print rate by time. Wireless, weight, and ink brand are irrelevant.

questions.question: A recipe calls for 2/3 cup of oil. The oil is olive oil from Spain, extra virgin grade. To make 6 batches, how many cups of oil needed?
questions.hint: Multiply oil per batch by number of batches. Oil type, origin, and grade are irrelevant.

questions.question: A stadium holds 50,000 fans. The stadium was built in 2005, has artificial turf, and hosts soccer games. If 72% of seats are filled, how many fans?
questions.hint: Find 72% of total capacity. Year built, turf type, and sport are irrelevant.

questions.question: A bag contains 45 marbles: 20 red, 15 blue, and 10 green. The bag is velvet and was a birthday gift. What fraction are blue?
questions.hint: Divide blue marbles by total marbles. Bag material and origin are irrelevant.

questions.question: A car travels 180 km using 15 liters of fuel. The car is a 2019 model with sunroof and GPS. What's the fuel efficiency in km/liter?
questions.hint: Divide distance by fuel used. Model year and features are irrelevant.

questions.question: A carpenter cuts a 240 cm board into equal pieces of 30 cm each. The wood is pine, the saw is electric, and the workshop is in the garage. How many pieces?
questions.hint: Divide total length by piece length. Wood type, saw, and location are irrelevant.

questions.question: A garden hose delivers 8 liters of water per minute. The hose is 25 m long and green. It was bought at Home Depot. How much water in 45 minutes?
questions.hint: Multiply flow rate by time. Hose length, color, and store are irrelevant.

questions.question: A classroom has 6 rows of desks with 5 desks per row. Each desk costs $75 and the chairs are blue. The classroom faces east. How many desks total?
questions.hint: Multiply rows by desks per row. Cost, chair color, and direction are irrelevant.

questions.question: A recipe requires sugar and flour in a 2:5 ratio. The flour is organic and the recipe is gluten-free. For 350 g of flour, how much sugar?
questions.hint: Set up the proportion 2/5 = sugar/350. Flour type and dietary info are irrelevant.

questions.question: A train ticket costs $45 for adults and $25 for children. The train has WiFi and a dining car. If a family buys 2 adult and 3 child tickets, total cost?
questions.hint: Calculate (adults x adult price) + (children x child price). Train amenities are irrelevant.

questions.question: A swimming pool is 50 m long. A swimmer does 12 laps. The pool is heated to 28C and has 8 lanes. Total distance swum?
questions.hint: Multiply pool length by number of laps. Temperature and lanes are irrelevant.

questions.question: A shop sells 3 pens for $5. The pens are ballpoint, available in 5 colors, and made in Japan. How much for 12 pens?
questions.hint: Find how many sets of 3 are in 12, then multiply by $5. Pen type, colors, and origin are irrelevant.

questions.question: A clock loses 2 minutes every hour. It's an antique from 1920 with a wooden case. After 5 hours, how many minutes has it lost?
questions.hint: Multiply minutes lost per hour by number of hours. Age and case material are irrelevant.

questions.question: A bakery makes 120 loaves per day. Each loaf uses 400 g of flour and sells for $4. The bakery opens at 6 AM. Weekly loaf production?
questions.hint: Multiply daily production by 7 days. Flour, price, and opening time are irrelevant.

questions.question: A cylinder has diameter 10 cm and height 14 cm. It's made of aluminum and painted silver. What's its radius?
questions.hint: Radius = diameter / 2. Material and paint color are irrelevant.

questions.question: A store marks up products by 40%. An item costs the store $25 to buy. The store is part of a chain with 200 locations. What's the selling price?
questions.hint: Add 40% of cost to the cost. Chain size is irrelevant.

questions.question: A cyclist travels at 24 km/h. Her bike has 21 gears, carbon frame, and LED lights. How far in 2 hours 30 minutes?
questions.hint: Convert time to hours, then multiply by speed. Gears, frame, and lights are irrelevant.

questions.question: A quiz has 80 questions. A student answers 65 correctly. The quiz is timed at 45 minutes and is about geography. What percentage correct?
questions.hint: Divide correct by total and multiply by 100. Time and subject are irrelevant.

questions.question: A farmer plants trees in a grid of 8 rows and 12 columns. The trees are apple trees, 3 years old, and organic. How many trees total?
questions.hint: Multiply rows by columns. Tree type, age, and organic status are irrelevant.

questions.question: A company ships 450 packages daily. Each package weighs 2 kg on average. The company uses FedEx and has 30 trucks. How many packages in 5 days?
questions.hint: Multiply daily shipments by number of days. Weight, carrier, and trucks are irrelevant.

questions.question: A square garden has sides of 9 m. The soil is rich in nitrogen and the fence is metal. The garden gets 6 hours of sunlight. What's the area?
questions.hint: Area of square = side x side. Soil, fence, and sunlight are irrelevant.

questions.question: A phone costs $800 with a 15% discount. The phone has 128 GB storage, 5G capability, and comes in 4 colors. What's the discounted price?
questions.hint: Subtract 15% from original price (or multiply by 0.85). Storage, 5G, and colors are irrelevant.

questions.question: A bank account earns 3% simple interest annually. The bank has 50 branches and was founded in 1920. On $500 principal, how much interest in 2 years?
questions.hint: Simple interest = principal x rate x time. Branches and founding year are irrelevant.

questions.question: A movie is 2 hours 15 minutes long. It's a comedy, rated PG-13, and has 5 Oscar nominations. How many minutes is the movie?
questions.hint: Convert hours to minutes and add remaining minutes. Genre, rating, and nominations are irrelevant.

questions.question: A restaurant has 18 tables with 4 chairs each. The restaurant serves Italian food and has a Michelin star. Maximum seating capacity?
questions.hint: Multiply tables by chairs per table. Food type and rating are irrelevant.

questions.question: A painter charges $35/hour. He uses acrylic paints, has 15 years experience, and drives a white van. For an 8-hour job, labor cost?
questions.hint: Multiply hourly rate by hours. Paint type, experience, and van color are irrelevant.

questions.question: A recipe makes 24 cookies. Each cookie has 80 calories and 5 g of sugar. The recipe is from a food blog. If you eat 6 cookies, how many calories?
questions.hint: Multiply calories per cookie by cookies eaten. Sugar and recipe source are irrelevant.

questions.question: A water bottle holds 750 ml. It's made of stainless steel and costs $25. If you drink 4 full bottles, how many liters?
questions.hint: Multiply capacity by bottles and convert ml to liters. Material and cost are irrelevant.

questions.question: A building has 15 floors. Each floor has 8 apartments. The building has a gym and underground parking. Total apartments?
questions.hint: Multiply floors by apartments per floor. Amenities are irrelevant.

questions.question: A farmer harvests 2,500 kg of wheat. The farm is 50 hectares and uses organic methods. Wheat sells for $0.40/kg. Total revenue?
questions.hint: Multiply harvest by price per kg. Farm size and methods are irrelevant.

questions.question: A lamp uses 60 watts. It has a brass base and silk shade. Electricity costs $0.15/kWh. If used for 5 hours, energy used in watt-hours?
questions.hint: Multiply watts by hours. Base, shade, and electricity cost are irrelevant.

questions.question: A jar contains coins: 35 quarters, 50 dimes, and 25 nickels. The jar is glass and hand-painted. How many coins total?
questions.hint: Add all the coins together. Jar material and decoration are irrelevant.

questions.question: A field is 120 m long and 80 m wide. The grass is Kentucky bluegrass and was planted last year. What's the perimeter?
questions.hint: Perimeter = 2 x (length + width). Grass type and planting date are irrelevant.

questions.question: A bus holds 52 passengers. The bus is electric, has AC, and runs route 42. If 75% of seats are filled, how many passengers?
questions.hint: Find 75% of total capacity. Fuel type, AC, and route number are irrelevant.

questions.question: A factory produces 150 widgets per machine per hour. There are 4 machines. The factory is in Ohio and operates 24/7. Widgets per hour?
questions.hint: Multiply production per machine by number of machines. Location and hours are irrelevant.

questions.question: A gas station sells fuel at $3.80/gallon. The station has 12 pumps and a convenience store. If you buy 8 gallons, total cost?
questions.hint: Multiply gallons by price per gallon. Pumps and store are irrelevant.

questions.question: A triangle has base 14 cm and height 9 cm. It's drawn with a ruler on white paper. The triangle is isosceles. What's the area?
questions.hint: Area of triangle = 1/2 x base x height. Tools, paper, and triangle type are irrelevant.

questions.question: A subscription costs $9.99/month. The service has 50 million subscribers and offers 4K streaming. Annual cost?
questions.hint: Multiply monthly cost by 12. Subscriber count and features are irrelevant.

questions.question: A jogger runs 4 km in 24 minutes. She runs in the park, wears Adidas shoes, and listens to music. What's her speed in km/h?
questions.hint: Convert minutes to hours, then divide distance by time. Location, shoes, and music are irrelevant.

questions.question: A theater sells tickets for $12 adults and $8 children. The theater has velvet curtains and crystal chandeliers. If 45 adults and 30 children attend, total revenue?
questions.hint: Calculate (adults x adult price) + (children x child price). Decor is irrelevant.

questions.question: A water heater uses 4,500 watts. It's tankless, Energy Star rated, and costs $800. If used for 2 hours daily, daily energy in kWh?
questions.hint: Multiply watts by hours and divide by 1000. Type, rating, and cost are irrelevant.

questions.question: A class has 32 students. 18 are girls. The teacher's name is Mrs. Johnson and the classroom is on floor 2. How many boys?
questions.hint: Subtract girls from total. Teacher name and floor are irrelevant.

questions.question: A pizza shop charges $2 per topping. The base pizza costs $10. The shop has 15 topping options and opens at 11 AM. For a pizza with 4 toppings, total cost?
questions.hint: Add base price to (toppings x topping price). Options and hours are irrelevant.

questions.question: A rope is 45 m long. It's 2 cm thick and made of hemp. If cut into pieces of 5 m each, how many pieces?
questions.hint: Divide total length by piece length. Thickness and material are irrelevant.

questions.question: A laptop screen is 16 inches diagonally. The laptop has 8 GB RAM, SSD storage, and weighs 1.8 kg. Screen size in cm? (1 inch = 2.54 cm)
questions.hint: Multiply inches by 2.54. RAM, storage, and weight are irrelevant.

questions.question: A delivery truck makes 8 stops per route. Each stop takes 15 minutes. The truck is a Ford, 5 years old, and white. Total time for stops in hours?
questions.hint: Multiply stops by time per stop and convert to hours. Truck details are irrelevant.

questions.question: A shop sells fabric at $8.50/meter. The fabric is cotton, comes in 20 patterns, and is machine washable. Cost for 6 meters?
questions.hint: Multiply length by price per meter. Material, patterns, and care instructions are irrelevant.

questions.question: A building casts a 24 m shadow. The sun angle is 45 degrees. The building is made of concrete and glass. How tall is the building?
questions.hint: At 45 degrees, shadow length equals height. Materials are irrelevant.

questions.question: A savings account has $1,200. The bank offers free checking and a mobile app. If you withdraw 1/3, how much remains?
questions.hint: Subtract 1/3 from total (or find 2/3 of total). Bank features are irrelevant.

questions.question: A soccer field is 100 m long and 60 m wide. The grass is artificial and the stadium holds 45,000 fans. What's the field area?
questions.hint: Area = length x width. Grass type and stadium capacity are irrelevant.

questions.question: A box contains 24 packs of gum. Each pack has 12 pieces. The gum is mint flavored and sugar-free. Total pieces of gum?
questions.hint: Multiply packs by pieces per pack. Flavor and sugar content are irrelevant.

questions.question: A worker earns $18/hour and gets time-and-a-half for overtime. She has 5 years experience and works at ABC Corp. For 4 hours of overtime, extra pay?
questions.hint: Time-and-a-half means 1.5 x regular rate for overtime hours. Experience and company are irrelevant.

questions.question: A garden bed is a rectangle 3 m by 2 m. Soil costs $5/m squared. The soil is organic and the bed has wooden edges. Cost to fill with soil?
questions.hint: Find area, then multiply by cost per m squared. Soil type and edges are irrelevant.

questions.question: A recipe needs milk and cream in a 3:1 ratio. The dairy is from local farms and organic. For 2 cups of cream, how much milk?
questions.hint: Set up the ratio: milk/cream = 3/1, so milk = 3 x cream. Source and organic status are irrelevant.

questions.question: A parking garage charges $4 for the first hour and $2 each additional hour. The garage has 500 spaces and 24/7 security. Cost for 5 hours?
questions.hint: Add first hour cost to (additional hours x additional rate). Spaces and security are irrelevant.

questions.question: A rectangular prism has length 8 cm, width 5 cm, and height 3 cm. It's made of wood and stained brown. What's the volume?
questions.hint: Volume = length x width x height. Material and stain are irrelevant.

questions.question: A train leaves every 20 minutes. The station has 6 platforms and a coffee shop. The first train is at 6:00 AM. What time is the 5th train?
questions.hint: The 5th train is 4 intervals after the 1st. Platforms and shops are irrelevant.

questions.question: A company's revenue was $450,000. Expenses were $280,000. The company has 45 employees and was founded in 2005. What's the profit?
questions.hint: Profit = revenue - expenses. Employees and founding year are irrelevant.

questions.question: A bookshelf holds 35 books per shelf. It has 4 shelves and is made of oak. The shelf is 180 cm tall. Total book capacity?
questions.hint: Multiply books per shelf by number of shelves. Material and height are irrelevant.

questions.question: A container ship carries 8,000 containers. Each container weighs 2.5 tons. The ship is 300 m long and has a crew of 25. Total cargo weight?
questions.hint: Multiply containers by weight per container. Ship length and crew are irrelevant.

questions.question: A circle has diameter 20 cm. It's drawn on cardboard with a compass. The cardboard is recycled. What's the radius?
questions.hint: Radius = diameter / 2. Tools and cardboard source are irrelevant.

questions.question: A discount store marks everything 30% off. A jacket originally costs $85. The jacket is leather and imported. What's the sale price?
questions.hint: Subtract 30% from original (or multiply by 0.70). Material and origin are irrelevant.

questions.question: A bus makes 6 trips per day. Each trip is 15 km. The bus runs on natural gas and seats 40. Daily distance traveled?
questions.hint: Multiply trips by distance per trip. Fuel type and seats are irrelevant.

questions.question: A painter has 5 liters of paint. Each wall needs 1.25 liters. The paint is eggshell finish and low-VOC. How many walls can be painted?
questions.hint: Divide total paint by paint per wall. Finish and VOC are irrelevant.

questions.question: A smartphone has 64 GB storage. Apps use 12 GB and photos use 18 GB. The phone is 6 months old and has a cracked screen. Free storage?
questions.hint: Subtract used storage from total. Age and screen condition are irrelevant.

questions.question: A ferry can carry 200 cars. It makes 5 crossings daily. The ferry was built in 2010 and has 3 decks. Maximum cars per day?
questions.hint: Multiply capacity by crossings. Build year and decks are irrelevant.

questions.question: A pizza is cut into 8 slices. Tom eats 3 slices. The pizza is pepperoni with extra cheese. What fraction did Tom eat?
questions.hint: Divide slices eaten by total slices. Toppings are irrelevant.

questions.question: A warehouse has 15 aisles. Each aisle has 40 shelves. The warehouse is climate-controlled and has forklifts. Total shelves?
questions.hint: Multiply aisles by shelves per aisle. Climate control and forklifts are irrelevant.

questions.question: A baker uses 2.5 kg of flour per batch of bread. Flour costs $1.20/kg. The flour is unbleached and organic. Flour cost for 6 batches?
questions.hint: Calculate total flour needed, then multiply by cost per kg. Flour type is irrelevant.

questions.question: A clock shows 3:45 PM. The clock is digital and made by Sony. It was a gift from grandma. What time will it be in 2 hours 30 minutes?
questions.hint: Add the time to current time. Clock type, brand, and source are irrelevant.

questions.question: A pool requires 45,000 liters of water. It takes 6 hours to fill. The pool is kidney-shaped with mosaic tiles. Fill rate per hour?
questions.hint: Divide total volume by time. Pool shape and tiles are irrelevant.

questions.question: A test has 60 questions. Each question is worth 1.5 points. The test is multiple choice and covers biology. Maximum score?
questions.hint: Multiply questions by points per question. Format and subject are irrelevant.

questions.question: A recipe serves 4 people. It uses 300 g of pasta. The pasta is imported from Italy and is gluten-free. For 12 people, how much pasta?
questions.hint: Find the multiplier (12/4 = 3) and multiply the pasta. Origin and gluten are irrelevant.

questions.question: A car depreciates 15% per year. It was bought for $30,000. The car is red and has leather seats. Value after 1 year?
questions.hint: Subtract 15% from original value (or multiply by 0.85). Color and seats are irrelevant.

questions.question: A garden produces 24 tomatoes per plant. There are 8 plants. The tomatoes are heirloom variety and organic. Total tomatoes?
questions.hint: Multiply tomatoes per plant by number of plants. Variety and organic status are irrelevant.

questions.question: A movie rental is $4.99. Late fee is $1.50/day. The movie is a documentary about nature. If returned 3 days late, total cost?
questions.hint: Add rental cost to (late fee x days late). Genre is irrelevant.

questions.question: A box is 30 cm long, 20 cm wide, and 15 cm tall. It's cardboard with handle holes. What's its volume in liters? (1 L = 1000 cm cubed)
questions.hint: Find volume in cm cubed, then divide by 1000. Material and handles are irrelevant.

questions.question: A jogger burns 400 calories per hour. She jogs for 45 minutes. She wears a fitness tracker and drinks electrolytes. Calories burned?
questions.hint: Convert minutes to hours fraction, then multiply by rate. Tracker and drinks are irrelevant.

questions.question: A tile is 25 cm by 25 cm. The tile is ceramic and made in Spain. A floor is 4 m by 3 m. How many tiles needed?
questions.hint: Find floor area, divide by tile area (in same units). Material and origin are irrelevant.

questions.question: A concert ticket costs $65. Service fee is 12% of ticket price. The concert is outdoors at City Park. Total cost including fee?
questions.hint: Add 12% of ticket price to the ticket price. Venue is irrelevant.

questions.question: A bathtub holds 200 liters. It drains at 10 liters/minute. The tub is cast iron and white. How long to empty?
questions.hint: Divide capacity by drain rate. Material and color are irrelevant.

questions.question: A shirt costs $35. Tax is 8%. The shirt is cotton, made in Vietnam, and size medium. Total with tax?
questions.hint: Add 8% of price to price. Material, origin, and size are irrelevant.

questions.question: A package weighs 2.5 kg. Shipping is $4.50/kg. The package is fragile and insured. Shipping cost?
questions.hint: Multiply weight by cost per kg. Fragile status and insurance are irrelevant.

questions.question: A museum has 1,500 artifacts. 40% are on display. The museum was built in 1890 and has 3 wings. How many on display?
questions.hint: Find 40% of total. Build year and wings are irrelevant.

questions.question: A pipe fills a tank at 5 liters/minute. Another pipe drains at 2 liters/minute. The tank is steel and cylindrical. Net fill rate?
questions.hint: Subtract drain rate from fill rate. Material and shape are irrelevant.

questions.question: A photocopier makes 30 copies/minute. It uses A4 paper and black toner. The copier is 2 years old. Copies in 8 minutes?
questions.hint: Multiply rate by time. Paper size, toner, and age are irrelevant.

questions.question: A lawn is 20 m by 15 m. Fertilizer covers 10 m squared per kg. The fertilizer is organic and costs $8/kg. How many kg needed?
questions.hint: Find area, then divide by coverage per kg. Organic status and cost are irrelevant.

questions.question: A call center handles 150 calls/hour. It operates 10 hours/day. The center has 45 employees and free coffee. Daily calls?
questions.hint: Multiply hourly calls by hours. Employees and coffee are irrelevant.

questions.question: A triangle has angles of 45 degrees and 65 degrees. It's drawn on tracing paper with a protractor. What's the third angle?
questions.hint: Triangle angles sum to 180 degrees. Paper and tools are irrelevant.

questions.question: A car rental is $45/day plus $0.20/km. The car is a sedan with GPS. For 3 days and 200 km, total cost?
questions.hint: Add (daily rate x days) to (rate per km x km). Car type and GPS are irrelevant.

questions.question: A fruit basket has 5 apples, 7 oranges, and 8 bananas. The basket is wicker and has a red bow. Total pieces of fruit?
questions.hint: Add all the fruit together. Basket material and bow are irrelevant.

questions.question: A gym class has 36 students. They form teams of 4. The gym is air-conditioned and has wooden floors. How many teams?
questions.hint: Divide total students by team size. Gym features are irrelevant.

questions.question: A bicycle wheel has diameter 70 cm. The bike is a mountain bike with 21 gears. Circumference? (pi = 3.14)
questions.hint: Circumference = pi x diameter. Bike type and gears are irrelevant.

questions.question: A factory makes 5,000 units/day. 2% are defective. The factory runs 24/7 and has 200 workers. Defective units per day?
questions.hint: Find 2% of daily production. Schedule and workers are irrelevant.

questions.question: A camp has 84 children. Counselors supervise groups of 7. The camp is in the mountains and has a lake. How many groups?
questions.hint: Divide children by group size. Location and lake are irrelevant.

questions.question: A solar panel produces 300 watts. There are 12 panels on the roof. The roof faces south and is 10 years old. Total power output?
questions.hint: Multiply watts per panel by number of panels. Direction and age are irrelevant.

questions.question: A highway is 240 km long. A car travels at 80 km/h. The highway has 4 lanes and 3 rest stops. Travel time?
questions.hint: Divide distance by speed. Lanes and rest stops are irrelevant.

questions.question: A deck has 52 cards. 4 are aces. The deck is plastic-coated and made by Bicycle. What fraction are aces?
questions.hint: Divide aces by total cards and simplify. Material and brand are irrelevant.

questions.question: A recipe uses butter and sugar in a 1:2 ratio. The recipe is for cookies and serves 24. For 150 g of butter, how much sugar?
questions.hint: Sugar is twice the butter amount. Recipe type and servings are irrelevant.
